Last Updated: October 2024

BridgeBio Mobile Texting Program Terms and Conditions

This program provides educational, informational, and marketing text messages from BridgeBio, BridgeBio affiliates, and Companies working with BridgeBio (collectively, BridgeBio). By opting in to the BridgeBio SMS text messaging program (the “BridgeBio SMS Program”), you consent to receive text messages from BridgeBio at the mobile number provided. Frequency may vary and may include one-time or recurring texts. Text messages may be sent to your mobile number using an automatic dialing system. Message and Data rates may apply.

You can unsubscribe from a BridgeBio SMS Program at any time by replying with the word “STOP”.

Support/Help

You can request more information or obtain help by replying to messages from the BridgeBio SMS Program with the word HELP.

Privacy

You agree to BridgeBio’s privacy policy, available at https://bridgebio.com/bridgebio-global-privacy-policy/, which is hereby incorporated as part of these terms.

For information on data collection and use, please read our full corporate Privacy Policy and terms of use at https://bridgebio.com/bridgebio-global-privacy-policy/, which is incorporated by reference into these terms.

Your Mobile Telephone Number

You attest that you are the account holder for the mobile telephone number(s) that you provide to opt in to the BridgeBio SMS Program. You are responsible for notifying BridgeBio immediately if you change your mobile telephone number. You may notify BridgeBio of a number change by calling 650-391-9740.

Cost

Message and data rates may apply to each text message sent or received in connection with the texting program, as provided in your mobile telephone service rate plan (please contact your mobile telephone carrier for pricing plans), in addition to any applicable roaming charges. Charges are both billed and payable to your mobile service provider or deducted from your prepaid account. BridgeBio does not impose a separate fee for sending text messages.

Indemnification and Limitation of Liability

You agree to indemnify BridgeBio and parties texting on its behalf in full for all claims, expenses, and damages related to or caused in whole or in part by your failure to notify BridgeBio if you change your telephone number, including but not limited to all claims, expenses, and damages related to or arising under the Telephone Consumer  Protection Act.

Amendment and Termination of Text Messaging

BridgeBio may revise, modify, or amend the BridgeBio SMS Program Terms and Conditions at any time. Any such revision, modification, or amendment shall take effect when it is posted to BridgeBio’s website. You agree to review the text messaging program Terms and Conditions periodically to ensure that you are aware of any changes.  Your continued consent to receive text messages will indicate your acceptance of  those changes.

BridgeBio may suspend or terminate your receipt of text messages if it believes you are  in breach of these text messaging program Terms and Conditions. Your receipt of text messages is also subject to termination in the event that your mobile telephone service terminates or lapses. BridgeBio reserves the right to modify or discontinue, temporarily or permanently, all or any part of the text messaging services you receive, with or  without notice.

Supported Carriers and Potential Interruption

The service may not be available through all mobile carriers.

The service is available only on these US participating mobile carriers:  AT&T, Verizon Wireless, Sprint, and T-Mobile USA, Indigo Wireless, MetroPCS, Bluegrass Cellular, Illinois Valley Cellular, Viaero Wireless, Pine Belt, GCI Communications, Nex Tech Communications, Shelcomm, and Duet Wireless.

Alerts sent via SMS may not be delivered if the mobile phone is not in range of a transmission site, or if sufficient network capacity is not available at a particular time. Even within a coverage area, factors beyond the control of the wireless carrier may interfere with message delivery, including the customer’s equipment, terrain, proximity to buildings, foliage, and weather. The wireless carrier does not guarantee that alerts will be delivered and will not be held liable for delayed or undelivered messages.

We do not guarantee the successful delivery of text messages by your wireless provider. Messages sent by text may not be delivered if the mobile device is not in range of a transmission site, or if the network is down. Factors beyond the power of wireless carriers may get in the way of message delivery. We and your wireless provider will not be liable for losses or damages that come from:

  • a message not delivered, a message delivered late, or
  • a message that goes to the wrong number; or
  • inaccurate or incomplete content in a text message.
  • We are not liable for your use or reliance on the content of any text message.

If you have any questions about your text plan or data plan, it is best to contact your wireless provider.
